name: vscode-catch2-test-adapter
description: Run your Catch2 tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code
author: Mate Pek

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build

configuration.title: Configuration for the Catch2 Test Explorer extension

catch2TestExplorer.executables.description: The location of your test executables (relative to the workspace folder or absolute path) and with a lot of other setting. (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_advanced-search-options)

catch2TestExplorer.defaultEnv.description: Default environment variables to be set when running the tests, if it isn't provided in 'executables'. (Resolves: ${workspaceFolder})

catch2TestExplorer.defaultCwd.description: The working directory where the test is run (relative to the workspace folder or absolue path), if it isn't provided in 'executables'.  (Resolves: ${workspaceFolder})

catch2TestExplorer.defaultRngSeed.description: Specify a seed for the Random Number Generator. (ex.: '<number>', '"time"') For details see: https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/blob/master/docs/command-line.md#rng-seed

catch2TestExplorer.defaultWatchTimeoutSe.description: Test executables are being watched (only inside the workspace directory). In case of one compiles too much this variable can help with it.

catch2TestExplorer.workerMaxNumber.description: The variable maximize the number of the parallel test execution.

catch2TestExplorer.enableSourceDecoratio.description: Sets the source code decorations: Errored lines will be highlighted.

catch2TestExplorer.debugConfigTemplate.description: Set the necessary debug configuraitons and then the debug button will work.

catch2TestExplorer.debugBreakOnFailure.description: Debugger breaks on failure while debugging the test. This is a Catch2 parameter: --break

catch2TestExplorer.defaultNoThrow.description: Skips all assertions that test that an exception is thrown, e.g. REQUIRE_THROWS. This is a Catch2 parameter: --nothrow

catch2TestExplorer.logpanel.description: Create a new output channel and write the log messages there.

catch2TestExplorer.logfile.description: Write the log message into the given file.
